title: (x) Sony Ericsson, Hallmark, National Cherry Festival logos - custom {gang}
content:
Please help me to id these fonts. Thank you very much in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [a.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=a_25.jpg) | 74.42 KB |
author: contohabc

comments.content:
Sony and Hallmark are almost certainly custom logos.  
Hallmark in particular has been around a LOOONNNGGG time.

The new Sony logo is customized [Digital Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109114831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/digital-sans/ef-medium/testdrive.html?s=Sony+Ericsson&p=72).. and noting the differing “l” characters in Hallmark, I’d agree with Patty that it’s completely custom script.

These are in the same vein as Cherry but not matches  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/hombre-bt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109114831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/hombre-bt/)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sparkytype/mckracken/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109114831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sparkytype/mckracken/)

Tim

I think that Cherry is T-26’s [Blue Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109114831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/blue-century/blue-century/testdrive.html?s=National+Cherry+Festival&p=48) slightly modified, like the N.

http://www.corbindesign.com/portfolio/cherryfest.html  
these are the guys to have created the cherry festival ID. If the font is that important to you, I guess you could always try asking them for reference.
